content.raw: Hm, I wonder if that dataframe indexing helps. Yes, the string comparison is slow but I think only because it is being done once for every row in the dataframe. Whereas with the indexing if it's implemented well it should be something like a dictionary lookup, which is a hash-table and only does one string comparison (well, if you're lucky it does only one - it might do two or three but definitely not *n*). Definitely something I'll keep in mind for future performance improvements!
content.html: Hm, I wonder if that dataframe indexing helps. Yes, the string comparison is slow but I think only because it is being done once for every row in the dataframe. Whereas with the indexing if it's implemented well it should be something like a dictionary lookup, which is a hash-table and only does one string comparison (well, if you're lucky it does only one - it might do two or three but definitely not n). Definitely something I'll keep in mind for future performance improvements!
